availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Owen County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah Thomas in Owen County, Kentucky on April 15, 1839. Father of Spencer Thomas, John Thomas, America Thomas, Mary E. Thomas, Susan Thomas, Reuban Thomas, and Ann M. Thomas. Farmer in Owen County in 1850. Owen seven enslaved persons in 1850. Farmer in Owen County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owen County, District 1, p. 247A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Owen County, District 1, p. 411.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owen County, District 2, p. 221.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Owen County, District 2, p. 182A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Owen County Marriages, Film #000272772, p. 455 (on microfilm), (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "Jordan Thomas (25 Dec 1797-11 Jan 1877)," Memorial #20810289, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/20810289 (accessed June 18, 2020).
